intro: Ricinocarpus mannianus, commonly known as the mangrove apple, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is typically found in coastal areas, including mangrove forests. The plant has a distinctive appearance with smooth, dark bark and broad, ovate leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange or red berries containing a single seed. The plant is adapted to saline environments and plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems.
